div1.head: Report from Rafael T. Echeverria to the Adjutant General, July 16, 1900
div1.p:
CIVIL DIVISION.
Military sanitary office,
DIVISION OF CUBA.
Quemados, Cuba, July 16, 1900.

HEADQUARTERS
DEPARTMENT OF HAVANA
& PINAR DEL RIO.

CIVIL FILE
Recd. JUL 17 1900
No. 576-A-

Headquarters Division of Cuba,
Received JUL 19 1900

Chief Surgeon's Office,
Hdqrs. Dept. of Havana,
and Pinar del Rio,
Quemados, Cuba.

Military File,
Rec'd
JUL 16 1900
No. 879

Major R. Echeverria,
Military Sanitary Officer.

Submits report for the week ending
July 14, 1900.

OK
1

1st Endorsement.
CHIEF SURGEON'S OFFICE,
HEADQUARTERS DEPARTMENT OF HAVANA
AND PINAR DEL RIO,
Quemados, Cuba, July 16, 1900.

Respectfully forwarded to the Adjt.
General of the Dept., contents noted.

A.N. Stark.

2d Endorsement.
HEADQUARTERS DEPARTMENT OF HAVANA
AND PINAR DEL RIO.

Fitz Lee
Brigadier General Commanding.

div1.head: Report from Rafael T. Echeverria to the Adjutant General, July 16, 1900
div1.opener:
FROM THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES - Nil gov of Cuba
letters received -- re YF
File under Echeverria
Office Military Sanitary Officer
Quemados, July 16, 1900.
To the
Adjutant General,
Department of Havana and Pinar del Rio.
Through Chief Surgeon
Sir:
div1.p:
According to report received from the municipality of
Marianao for the week ending July 14, 1900 I have the honor
to inform you that during that period one death occurred, an
adult male, from yellow fever. No other deaths are reported.
Six children were born. Two successful and 5 unsuccessful
vaccinations are reported. No case of infectious disease remained.
div1.closer:
Respectfully R T Echeverria Major & Surgeon, U.S. Vols.
Military Sanitary Officer.
